data.text: Happy is the husband of a good wife;
A brave woman rejoiceth her husband;
A good wife is a good portion:
Whether a man be rich or poor,
Of three things my heart was afraid;
A grief of heart and sorrow is a woman that is jealous of another  woman,
A wicked woman is as  a yoke of oxen shaken to and fro:
A drunken woman causeth  great wrath;
The whoredom of a woman is in the lifting up of her eyes;
Keep strict watch on a headstrong daughter,
Look well after an impudent eye;
She will open her mouth, as a thirsty traveller,
The grace of a wife will delight her husband;
A silent woman is a gift of the Lord;
A shamefast woman is grace upon grace;
As the sun when it ariseth in the highest places of the Lord,
As the lamp that shineth upon the holy candlestick,
As the golden pillars are upon a base of silver,
Verses 19-27 are omitted by the best authorities.
For two things my heart is grieved;
A merchant shall hardly keep himself from wrong doing;
